First relief convoy arrives in Iraq as allies struggle to clear the way



UMM QASR , Iraq ( AP )
0,2 GPE|3,4 GPE|5,6 ORG|0,4 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|1,4 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
0,2 GPE|3,4 GPE|5,6 ORG|0,4 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

The first sizable relief convoy arrived in Iraq during a sandstorm Wednesday as allied forces struggled to clear the way for more aid shipments , using dolphins to remove mines from waterways and hunting Iraqi fighters around the port of Umm Qasr .
4,5 VEH|7,8 GPE|14,15 PER|29,30 WEA|31,32 LOC|34,35 GPE|35,36 PER|38,39 FAC|40,42 GPE|34,36 ORG-AFF.Employment|35,39 PHYS.Located|38,41 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|38,42 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

Three days after U.S. President George W. Bush promised `` massive amounts '' of humanitarian aid , seven large , battered tractor - trailers arrived in Umm Qasr carrying food and water donated by Kuwaitis .

`` We planned for 30 trucks but we only got seven loaded because of the severe sandstorm , '' said E.J. Russell of the Humanitarian Operations Center , a joint U.S .- Kuwaiti agency .

Before the war , Iraqis depended on government rations distributed under the U.N. 's oil - for - food program .
4,5 GPE|7,8 GPE|12,13 ORG
4,5 GPE|7,8 GPE|12,13 ORG

The 7-year - old program allows Iraq to sell unlimited quantities of oil to buy food , medicine and other humanitarian goods .
6,7 GPE
6,7 GPE

The proceeds from oil sales are deposited in a U.N .- controlled escrow account .
9,10 ORG
9,10 ORG

The war has thrown the future of that program in doubt .



Because the United States and Britain failed to get U.N. backing for the war , Russia , France , Germany and China want to ensure that the immediate humanitarian costs of the war are paid by the United States

_ and not the United Nations .

0,1 PER|5,6 ORG
0,1 PER|5,6 ORG

U.S. paratroopers parachute into northern Iraq , secure airfield , link up with Kurdish militia



IRBIL , Iraq ( AP )
0,1 GPE|2,3 GPE|4,5 ORG|0,3 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

Kurdish militiamen and U.S. special operations troops linked up with more than 1,000 U.S. Army paratroopers Thursday to secure the area around a strategic air strip , as the first large coalition ground force in northern Iraq began opening another front against Saddam Hussein 's regime .

20030404



Russia accepts World Bank loan to combat AIDS , tuberculosis



MOSCOW ( AP )
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG

Russia has accepted a US$ 150 million World Bank loan to combat the spread of AIDS and tuberculosis , ending a negotiating process that lasted four years , World Bank officials said Friday .
0,1 GPE|7,9 ORG|28,30 ORG|30,31 PER|28,31 ORG-AFF.Employment|29,31 ORG-AFF.Employment
0,1 GPE|7,9 ORG|28,30 ORG|30,31 PER|28,31 ORG-AFF.Employment

The World Bank first offered the loan in 1999 , but disagreements over treatment kept the project on hold .
1,3 ORG
1,3 ORG

Russia objected to World Bank rules that required monitoring of patients receiving medication , the World Bank said .
0,1 GPE|3,5 ORG|10,11 PER|15,17 ORG|0,11 GEN-AFF.Citizen-Resident-Religion-Ethnicity
0,1 GPE|3,5 ORG|10,11 PER|15,17 ORG|0,11 GEN-AFF.Citizen-Resident-Religion-Ethnicity

But after drawn - out talks , President Vladimir Putin signed off on the loan , which will take effect this year , the World Bank said .
7,8 PER|8,10 PER|24,26 ORG
7,8 PER|8,10 PER|24,26 ORG

`` Russia has one of the fastest growing AIDS epidemics in the world '' and has a `` fearsome '' problem with tuberculosis , particularly drug - resistant strains , said Olesoji Adeyi , a World Bank health specialist .
1,2 GPE|12,13 LOC|31,33 PER|35,37 ORG|38,39 PER|1,13 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|35,39 ORG-AFF.Employment|36,39 ORG-AFF.Employment
1,2 GPE|12,13 LOC|31,33 PER|35,37 ORG|38,39 PER|1,13 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|35,39 ORG-AFF.Employment

`` It 's a potential dual epidemic , '' he said , adding that people with immune systems weakened by the AIDS virus are especially vulnerable to contracting TB , which he called an `` opportunistic disease . ''
14,15 PER
14,15 PER

AIDS came relatively late to Russia , but spread rapidly , primarily due to intravenous drug abuse and a lack of prevention programs . Officials have registered more than 230,000 cases of HIV , though health experts say the actual number of HIV infections tops 1 million .
5,6 GPE|24,25 PER|36,37 PER
5,6 GPE|24,25 PER|36,37 PER

Tuberculosis , meanwhile , has also emerged as a serious problem , particularly in Russia 's overcrowded prisons .
14,15 GPE|17,18 FAC|14,18 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer
14,15 GPE|17,18 FAC|14,18 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer

UNITED NATIONS ( AP )
0,2 FAC|3,4 ORG
0,2 FAC|3,4 ORG

Iraq 's U.N. Ambassador Mohammed Al - Douri , the first Iraqi official to concede defeat in the U.S .- led war , met privately with Secretary - General Kofi Annan , but refused to talk about rumors that he was planning to leave New York .
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG|3,4 PER|4,8 PER|11,12 GPE|12,13 PER|18,19 GPE|26,29 PER|29,31 PER|44,46 GPE|0,4 ORG-AFF.Employment|11,13 ORG-AFF.Employment

`` I am sorry , '' he said .



`` No Answer . ''



`` No comment at all .



This is my last word to you , '' he told hordes of journalists who chased him Thursday at his New York residence and U.N. headquarters seeking comment on his talks with the secretary - general , his future and the war .

The troubled nuclear power plant in Temelin received permission from state authorities Monday to start power production at full capacity .
4,5 FAC|6,7 GPE|10,11 ORG|11,12 PER|4,7 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|10,12 ORG-AFF.Employment
4,5 FAC|6,7 GPE|10,11 ORG|11,12 PER|4,7 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|10,12 ORG-AFF.Employment

Pavel Pitterman , the spokesman for the State Office for Nuclear Safety , said his office gave the plant permission to run its second , newer 1,000-megawatt unit at full capacity .
0,2 PER|4,5 PER|7,12 ORG|15,16 ORG|18,19 FAC|4,8 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,9 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,10 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,11 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,12 ORG-AFF.Employment
0,2 PER|4,5 PER|7,12 ORG|15,16 ORG|18,19 FAC|4,12 ORG-AFF.Employment

The plant 's first 1,000-megawatt unit has already operated at full capacity during past tests .
1,2 FAC
1,2 FAC

The spokesman for the Temelin plant , Milan Nebesar , said that an 18-month trial production at full capacity at the second unit , needed to declare the unit ready for commercial production , would start Friday .
1,2 PER|4,5 GPE|5,6 ORG|7,9 PER|1,6 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,6 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
1,2 PER|4,5 GPE|5,6 ORG|7,9 PER|1,6 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,6 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

The plant , based on Russian design and upgraded with U.S. technology , has been plagued by frequent , non - nuclear malfunctions since testing began in November 2000 .
1,2 FAC|5,6 GPE|10,11 GPE
1,2 FAC|5,6 GPE|10,11 GPE

Located just 60 kilometers ( 35 miles ) north of the Austrian border , it has been a source of friction between the two countries .
11,12 GPE|12,13 LOC|24,25 GPE|11,13 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
11,12 GPE|12,13 LOC|24,25 GPE|11,13 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

Critics in non - nuclear Austria argue the plant is unsafe and demand that it be shut down , but Czech authorities insist the plant is safe .

A 13-point statement released after the meeting stressed the need to work toward a democratic Iraq built on the rule of law and equality . It also called for dissolving Saddam 's Baath Party but left open the question of separating church from the state .

Garner 's Office of Reconstruction and Humanitarian Assistance is charged with coordinating humanitarian assistance , rebuilding infrastructure shattered by years of war and U.N. sanctions , and gradually handing back power to Iraqis leading a democratically elected government .

20030416



Appeal launched against Russian journalist 's treason conviction



MOSCOW ( AP )
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG

The lawyer for a Russian military journalist convicted of treason filed an appeal Wednesday in an effort to overturn the guilty verdict against his client , who was released on parole earlier this year , news agencies reported .
1,2 PER|4,5 GPE|5,6 ORG|6,7 PER|24,25 PER|36,37 ORG|1,7 PER-SOC.Business|4,6 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|4,7 GEN-AFF.Citizen-Resident-Religion-Ethnicity
1,2 PER|4,5 GPE|5,6 ORG|6,7 PER|24,25 PER|36,37 ORG|1,7 PER-SOC.Business|4,6 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|4,7 GEN-AFF.Citizen-Resident-Religion-Ethnicity

Grigory Pasko 's lawyer Genri Reznik filed the appeal with Russian Supreme Court , the Interfax and ITAR - Tass news agencies reported .
0,2 PER|3,4 PER|4,6 PER|10,13 ORG|15,16 ORG|17,20 ORG|21,22 ORG|0,4 PER-SOC.Business|1,4 PER-SOC.Business
0,2 PER|3,4 PER|4,6 PER|10,13 ORG|15,16 ORG|17,20 ORG|21,22 ORG|0,4 PER-SOC.Business

He asked the court to invalidate the verdict and throw out the criminal case against Pasko , they said .
3,4 ORG|15,16 PER
3,4 ORG|15,16 PER

Pasko was sentenced to four years in prison in December 2001 for illegally attending a meeting of top military commanders and taking notes there .
0,1 PER|18,19 ORG|19,20 PER|18,20 ORG-AFF.Membership
0,1 PER|18,19 ORG|19,20 PER|18,20 ORG-AFF.Membership

A military court said he intended to pass the notes to Japanese media with which he had worked .
1,2 ORG|2,3 ORG|11,12 GPE|12,13 ORG|1,3 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|11,13 GEN-AFF.Org-Location
1,2 ORG|2,3 ORG|11,12 GPE|12,13 ORG|1,3 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|11,13 GEN-AFF.Org-Location

Pasko , whose sentence included time served , was released in January for good behavior after serving more than two - thirds of the sentence . He has maintained his innocence , saying the military was punishing him for exposing environmental abuses by the Russian navy , including the dumping of radioactive waste into the sea .
0,1 PER|34,35 ORG|44,45 GPE|45,46 ORG|55,56 LOC|44,46 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary
0,1 PER|34,35 ORG|44,45 GPE|45,46 ORG|55,56 LOC|44,46 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary

Reznik said an initial appeal he lodged the day Pasko was freed never reached the presidium of the Supreme Court , according to Interfax . The lawyer said the court 's military board had refused to launch proceedings on the appeal .
0,1 PER|9,10 PER|15,16 PER|18,20 ORG|23,24 ORG|26,27 PER|29,30 ORG|31,32 ORG|32,33 PER|15,19 ORG-AFF.Membership|15,20 ORG-AFF.Membership|29,33 ORG-AFF.Membership|31,33 ORG-AFF.Employment

Reznik said he addressed the new appeal directly to Supreme Court Chairman Vyacheslav Lebedev and asked that it not be considered by military judges `` because the military justice system has adopted a biased attitude against Pasko , '' Interfax reported .

UNITED NATIONS ( AP )
0,2 FAC|3,4 ORG
0,2 FAC|3,4 ORG

France on Tuesday proposed immediately suspending U.N. sanctions targeting Iraq civilians , an important step toward the U.S. goal of ending trade embargoes that have crippled the country 's economy .
0,1 GPE|6,7 ORG|9,10 GPE|10,11 PER|17,18 GPE|27,28 GPE|9,11 GEN-AFF.Citizen-Resident-Religion-Ethnicity
0,1 GPE|6,7 ORG|9,10 GPE|10,11 PER|17,18 GPE|27,28 GPE|9,11 GEN-AFF.Citizen-Resident-Religion-Ethnicity

The surprise move by France , which led opposition to the U.S. war against Iraq , followed last week 's call by U.S. President George W. Bush for sanctions to be lifted quickly , so Iraq can trade freely and its oil revenue can be used to finance reconstruction .
4,5 GPE|11,12 GPE|14,15 GPE|22,23 GPE|23,24 PER|24,27 PER|35,36 GPE|22,24 ORG-AFF.Employment
4,5 GPE|11,12 GPE|14,15 GPE|22,23 GPE|23,24 PER|24,27 PER|35,36 GPE|22,24 ORG-AFF.Employment

France 's U.N. ambassador , Jean - Marc de La Sabliere , made the proposal at a Security Council meeting where members heard a briefing by chief U.N. weapons inspector Hans Blix and for the first time exchanged views on potentially divisive postwar issues .
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG|3,4 PER|5,11 PER|17,19 ORG|21,22 PER|27,28 ORG|28,29 WEA|29,30 PER|30,32 PER|0,4 ORG-AFF.Employment|27,30 ORG-AFF.Membership

The proposal would end the U.N. ban on trade and investment in Iraq while leaving a 12-year - old arms embargo in place .
5,6 ORG|12,13 GPE|19,20 WEA
5,6 ORG|12,13 GPE|19,20 WEA

The Security Council imposed sanctions after Iraq 's 1990 invasion of Kuwait .
1,3 ORG|6,7 GPE|11,12 GPE
1,3 ORG|6,7 GPE|11,12 GPE

Under council resolutions , sanctions can not be lifted until U.N. inspectors certify that Iraq 's nuclear , chemical and biological weapons have been destroyed along with the long - range missiles to deliver them .
1,2 ORG|10,11 ORG|11,12 PER|14,15 GPE|16,17 WEA|18,19 WEA|20,21 WEA|21,22 WEA|31,32 WEA|10,12 ORG-AFF.Employment|14,22 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer

0,1 GPE|1,2 PER|28,29 LOC|30,31 GPE|0,2 ORG-AFF.Employment|28,31 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

1,5 ORG|16,17 LOC|18,19 LOC|19,20 FAC|23,24 PER
1,5 ORG|16,17 LOC|18,19 LOC|19,20 FAC|23,24 PER

Nine scanners , developed locally for military purposes , were placed at Singapore 's Changi Airport last week to check people arriving from SARS - affected countries .

Those who show up on the camera screen as `` hot bodies , '' or with a temperature greater than 37.5 degrees Celsius ( 99.5 degrees Fahrenheit ) , will be pulled aside .



Each day about 90,000 people cross the border between Malaysia and Singapore .
4,5 PER|7,8 LOC|9,10 GPE|11,12 GPE|7,10 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|7,12 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
4,5 PER|7,8 LOC|9,10 GPE|11,12 GPE|7,10 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|7,12 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

Any person found to be entering Singapore with a high temperature would be directed to a nearby nurse station for further checks .

1,2 PER|6,7 GPE|17,18 PER|18,19 FAC|1,7 PHYS.Located|1,19 PHYS.Located

Singapore has reported 16 deaths , the world 's third - highest toll , out of 186 infected from the flu - like illness .
0,1 GPE|7,8 LOC
0,1 GPE|7,8 LOC

Report : Accident on Chinese submarine kills all 70 aboard



BEIJING ( AP )
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG

An accident on a diesel - powered Chinese submarine has killed all 70 officers and sailors aboard , the official Xinhua News Agency reported Friday .
7,8 GPE|8,9 VEH|13,14 PER|15,16 PER|20,23 ORG|7,9 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer|8,14 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer|8,16 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer

The accident occurred `` recently '' in Chinese waters east of the Neichangshan islands , the brief Chinese - language report said .
7,8 GPE|8,9 LOC|12,14 LOC|7,9 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|8,13 PHYS.Near|8,14 PHYS.Near
7,8 GPE|8,9 LOC|12,14 LOC|7,9 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|8,14 PHYS.Near

The islands are in the Yellow Sea , between the northeastern province of Liaoning and North Korea .
1,2 LOC|5,7 LOC|11,12 GPE|13,14 GPE|15,17 GPE|1,6 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|1,7 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|5,12 PHYS.Near|6,12 PHYS.Near|5,16 PHYS.Near|5,17 PHYS.Near|6,16 PHYS.Near|6,17 PHYS.Near
1,2 LOC|5,7 LOC|11,12 GPE|13,14 GPE|15,17 GPE|1,7 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|5,12 PHYS.Near|5,17 PHYS.Near

The submarine was on an exercise when the accident occurred , and `` because of a mechanical malfunction , the 70 crew members on board died , '' the Xinhua report said .
1,2 VEH|21,22 PER|22,23 PER|29,30 ORG|1,23 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer
1,2 VEH|21,22 PER|22,23 PER|29,30 ORG|1,23 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer

It did not give further details or say how the crew died .
10,11 PER
10,11 PER

The vessel already has been towed back to an unidentified port , Xinhua said .
1,2 VEH|10,11 GPE|12,13 ORG
1,2 VEH|10,11 GPE|12,13 ORG

It said the hull number was 361 , which military analysts said appeared to make it a Ming - class submarine , a vessel used for patrols and coastal defense .
10,11 PER|17,18 VEH|20,21 VEH|23,24 VEH
10,11 PER|17,18 VEH|20,21 VEH|23,24 VEH

The announcement was unusual for a communist government that rarely acknowledges military accidents .
7,8 GPE
7,8 GPE

It was the first time China has announced a fatal submarine mishap , said Bernard Cole , a professor at the U.N. National War College in Washington and a specialist on the Chinese navy .
5,6 GPE|10,11 VEH|14,16 PER|18,19 PER|21,22 GPE|22,25 ORG|26,27 GPE|29,30 PER|32,33 GPE|33,34 ORG|18,23 ORG-AFF.Employment|18,24 ORG-AFF.Employment|18,25 ORG-AFF.Employment|21,23 GEN-AFF.Org-Location|21,24 GEN-AFF.Org-Location|21,25 GEN-AFF.Org-Location|22,27 GEN-AFF.Org-Location|23,27 GEN-AFF.Org-Location|24,27 GEN-AFF.Org-Location|32,34 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary

`` There have been rumors going around about the loss of submarines , but this is the first fatal accident that I know of , '' said Cole .
11,12 VEH|27,28 PER
11,12 VEH|27,28 PER

China 's military , which has a tradition of secrecy , did not comment about the accident Friday night .
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG|0,3 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary

Foreign military analysts said it would be highly unusual for an accident to kill a whole submarine crew while still allowing the vessel to be recovered .

They suggested possible causes ranging from a sinking in shallow water to a disaster that flooded the vessel with toxic chemical fumes .
17,18 VEH
17,18 VEH

Michael McGinty , an expert on the Chinese navy from the Royal United Services Institute for Defense Studies in London , said that the mishap likely happened while the submarine was on the surface .

If the accident happened when the vessel was underwater , it was less likely that China could have recovered it , said McGinty , a former British submariner .
6,7 VEH|15,16 GPE|22,23 PER|26,27 GPE|27,28 PER
6,7 VEH|15,16 GPE|22,23 PER|26,27 GPE|27,28 PER

`` For an accident to have been so catastrophic when the submarine was on the surface , I find it a very mysterious thing , '' he said .
11,12 VEH
11,12 VEH

McGinty said that the submarine 's batteries might have leaked acid that mixed with seawater , creating toxic chlorine gas that killed the crew .
0,1 PER|4,5 VEH|23,24 PER
0,1 PER|4,5 VEH|23,24 PER

The torpedoes might have leaked propellant that poisoned the crew , he said .
1,2 WEA|9,10 PER
1,2 WEA|9,10 PER

The accident could have occurred as long ago as March , said Cole , a former U.S. Navy antisubmarine warfare officer .

`` There have been exercises going on in the Yellow Sea over the past two months , '' he said .

9,11 LOC

2,3 VEH
2,3 VEH

Cole said the loss of all hands suggested the vessel was flooded or sank because of a collision or engineering problem .
0,1 PER|6,7 PER|9,10 VEH

He said Ming - class subs usually carry a crew of 50 , suggesting that the others aboard might have been technicians or staff officers .

China began building the Ming - class subs in the 1970s , and they are obsolete by modern standards , according to the Federation of American Scientists .
0,1 GPE|4,5 VEH|7,8 VEH|23,27 ORG
0,1 GPE|4,5 VEH|7,8 VEH|23,27 ORG

The first three Ming - class subs were completed between 1971 and 1979 , and one of them was scrapped after a fire , according to the Web site of Jane 's Information Group , a leading of source defense information . China is believed to have as many as 19 Ming - class submarines .

China 's submarine fleet includes 66 boats , most of them aging diesel - electric vessels , McGinty said .

U.S. , Britain drafting resolution limiting U.N. role in Iraq to humanitarian relief



LONDON ( AP )
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG
0,1 GPE|2,3 ORG

The United States and Britain are preparing a resolution that would give the United Nations a role in humanitarian relief but not peacekeeping in Iraq , a senior official in U.S. President George W. Bush 's administration said Friday .
1,3 GPE|4,5 GPE|13,15 ORG|24,25 GPE|28,29 PER|30,31 GPE|31,32 PER|32,35 PER|36,37 ORG|30,32 ORG-AFF.Employment
1,3 GPE|4,5 GPE|13,15 ORG|24,25 GPE|28,29 PER|30,31 GPE|31,32 PER|32,35 PER|36,37 ORG|30,32 ORG-AFF.Employment

Separately , the United States has decided to divide the military and humanitarian relief mission in Iraq into three parts under American , British and Polish command , the official said , speaking on condition of anonymity .
3,5 GPE|10,11 ORG|16,17 GPE|21,22 GPE|23,24 GPE|25,26 GPE|29,30 PER
3,5 GPE|10,11 ORG|16,17 GPE|21,22 GPE|23,24 GPE|25,26 GPE|29,30 PER

Six European countries have agreed to contribute troops to the British and Polish sectors to create an international stability force , the official said .
1,2 GPE|2,3 GPE|7,8 PER|10,11 GPE|12,13 GPE|13,14 ORG|19,20 ORG|22,23 PER|1,3 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|2,8 ORG-AFF.Employment|13,20 ORG-AFF.Membership

The draft resolution would limit the U.N. role to helping with refugees and displaced people , reconstruction and humanitarian assistance , the official said .
6,7 ORG|11,12 PER|14,15 PER|22,23 PER
6,7 ORG|11,12 PER|14,15 PER|22,23 PER

The United States and Britain agree on all but a few of the fine details of the resolution , the official said , though there is no timetable on when it would be introduced .
1,3 GPE|4,5 GPE|20,21 PER
1,3 GPE|4,5 GPE|20,21 PER

U.N. officials are already in Iraq providing humanitarian relief . U.N. Secretary General Kofi Annan said this week that the body has no interest in policing a postwar Iraq , although it could contribute to the political resuscitation of the country .
0,1 ORG|1,2 PER|5,6 GPE|10,11 ORG|11,12 PER|13,15 PER|20,21 ORG|28,29 GPE|40,41 GPE|0,2 ORG-AFF.Employment|1,6 PHYS.Located|10,12 ORG-AFF.Employment

`` Take the question of security .



I do n't think the U.N. would want to take on that , '' Annan said .
5,6 ORG|14,15 PER
5,6 ORG|14,15 PER

`` There has been a suggestion that the U.N. wanted to take over the whole Iraq and run it , which was also not the case . ''
8,9 ORG|15,16 GPE
8,9 ORG|15,16 GPE

What the United Nations could contribute beyond humanitarian assistance was `` political facilitation , '' Annan said .
2,4 ORG|15,16 PER
2,4 ORG|15,16 PER

The proposed draft resolution would probably face resistance from other U.N. Security Council members who have favored a U.N .- convened conference of the kind that helped establish Afghanistan 's post - Taliban government .

U.S. Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld discussed the resolution with Prime Minister Tony Blair and Defense Secretary Geoff Hoon on Friday as Rumsfeld returned from a tour of Iraq , Afghanistan and the Persian Gulf region .

1,2 PER
1,2 PER

The six nations contributing troops are Italy , Spain , Ukraine , Denmark , the Netherlands and Bulgaria , the official said . The international stabilization force would be under the U.S. war commander , Gen. Tommy Franks .

3,4 ORG|8,9 GPE|10,11 PER|12,13 PER|13,15 PER|8,11 ORG-AFF.Employment

At least initially , the coalition stability forces will augment rather than replace the 135,000 American troops inside Iraq , the official said .
7,8 ORG|15,16 GPE|16,17 PER|18,19 GPE|21,22 PER|15,17 ORG-AFF.Employment|16,19 PHYS.Located

The stability forces will focus on providing security and humanitarian relief while other U.S. troops focus on rooting out leftover members of Saddam Hussein 's government and other armed elements in Iraq .

Rumsfeld said , however , that the more troops other countries contribute to the stability effort , the fewer U.S. troops will be needed inside Iraq .
0,1 PER|8,9 PER|10,11 GPE|19,20 GPE|20,21 PER|25,26 GPE|8,11 ORG-AFF.Employment|19,21 ORG-AFF.Employment|20,26 PHYS.Located

Planning for both the U.N. resolution and the international security force left out France , Germany and Russia , three U.S. allies that vehemently opposed the war in Iraq .

The U.S. , British and Polish sectors will be drawn to take into account ethnic , religious , tribal and political factions within Iraq , the official said .

0,1 GPE|2,3 GPE|4,5 ORG|0,3 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

A state security court suspended a newspaper critical of the government Saturday after convicting it of publishing religiously inflammatory material , the newspaper 's lawyer said .
1,2 GPE|3,4 ORG|6,7 ORG|10,11 GPE|22,23 ORG|24,25 PER|1,4 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|22,25 ORG-AFF.Employment
1,2 GPE|3,4 ORG|6,7 ORG|10,11 GPE|22,23 ORG|24,25 PER|1,4 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|22,25 ORG-AFF.Employment

The Khartoum Monitor may not appear for two months and must pay a fine of 1 million Sudanese pounds ( about US$ 400 ) , lawyer Ngor Olang Ngor told The Associated Press .
1,3 ORG|17,18 GPE|25,26 PER|26,29 PER|31,33 ORG
1,3 ORG|17,18 GPE|25,26 PER|26,29 PER|31,33 ORG

Failure to pay the fine would result in a two - month extension of the suspension .



The sentence was the latest in a series of state actions against the Monitor , the only English language daily in Sudan and a leading critic of conditions in the south of the country , where a civil war has been waged for 20 years .
9,10 GPE|13,14 ORG|19,20 ORG|21,22 GPE|25,26 ORG|30,31 LOC|33,34 GPE|19,22 GEN-AFF.Org-Location|30,34 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

Ngor said the paper would pay the fine but it would also appeal the verdict .
0,1 PER|3,4 ORG
0,1 PER|3,4 ORG

The court ruling stated that the verdict and sentence would be submitted to the National Press Council , a government - appointed body , for approval , Ngor said .
1,2 ORG|14,17 ORG|19,20 GPE|22,23 ORG|27,28 PER
1,2 ORG|14,17 ORG|19,20 GPE|22,23 ORG|27,28 PER

The secretary general of the National Press Council , Hashim el - Jazz , did not answer repeated calls to his cell phone on Saturday .
1,2 PER|5,8 ORG|9,13 PER|1,6 ORG-AFF.Membership|1,7 ORG-AFF.Membership|1,8 ORG-AFF.Membership
1,2 PER|5,8 ORG|9,13 PER|1,8 ORG-AFF.Membership

The court convicted the paper of violating article 25 of the Press Law , which prohibits the publication of material that defames religion or incites religiously unacceptable activity .
1,2 ORG|4,5 ORG
1,2 ORG|4,5 ORG

The charges arose from letters - to - the - editor published last month that dealt with religion .
10,11 PER
10,11 PER

One letter claimed that alcohol was not prohibited by Islam .



Earlier this week , security police detained the Monitor 's managing editor , Nhial Bol , for 24 hours .
5,6 PER|8,9 ORG|11,12 PER|13,15 PER|8,12 ORG-AFF.Employment
5,6 PER|8,9 ORG|11,12 PER|13,15 PER|8,12 ORG-AFF.Employment

On his release , he was charged with incitement of public discord for publishing the letters .



Sudan has an Islamic - orientated government and a substantial Christian minority .

0,1 GPE|6,7 GPE|10,11 PER|11,12 PER|0,12 GEN-AFF.Citizen-Resident-Religion-Ethnicity

In a separate action against the Monitor , security officials went to its editorial offices on Thursday night and told the management that it was being closed until it paid a fine of 15 million Sudanese pounds ( about US$ 6,000 ) that was outstanding from a court conviction last year .

U.S. lawmaker : North Korea says it will produce more nukes



SEOUL , South Korea ( AP )



North Korea has told American lawmakers it already has nuclear weapons and intends to build more , a senior U.S. congressman said Monday after returning from a trip to the communist state .
0,2 GPE|4,5 GPE|5,6 PER|10,11 WEA|19,20 GPE|20,21 PER|31,32 GPE|4,6 ORG-AFF.Employment
0,2 GPE|4,5 GPE|5,6 PER|10,11 WEA|19,20 GPE|20,21 PER|31,32 GPE|4,6 ORG-AFF.Employment

`` They admitted to having nuclear capability and weapons at this moment , '' said Rep. Curt Weldon , who headed a delegation of U.S. lawmakers that visited Pyongyang for three days ending Sunday .
8,9 WEA|15,16 PER|16,18 PER|22,23 PER|24,25 GPE|25,26 PER|28,29 GPE|24,26 ORG-AFF.Employment
8,9 WEA|15,16 PER|16,18 PER|22,23 PER|24,25 GPE|25,26 PER|28,29 GPE|24,26 ORG-AFF.Employment

`` They admitted to an effort to expand their nuclear production program . ''



Weldon 's comments echoed those of U.S. officials following talks in Beijing in April .
0,1 PER|6,7 GPE|7,8 PER|11,12 GPE|6,8 ORG-AFF.Employment
0,1 PER|6,7 GPE|7,8 PER|11,12 GPE|6,8 ORG-AFF.Employment

They said that North Korea claimed during a pause in the formal talks that it already had nuclear weapons , but would give up the program in return for economic aid and security guarantees .
3,5 GPE|18,19 WEA
3,5 GPE|18,19 WEA

Weldon said at a news conference in Seoul that North Korean Vice Foreign Minister Kim Kye Gwan repeated that claim during a dinner meeting .
0,1 PER|7,8 GPE|9,11 GPE|13,14 PER|14,17 PER|0,8 PHYS.Located|9,14 ORG-AFF.Employment|10,14 ORG-AFF.Employment
0,1 PER|7,8 GPE|9,11 GPE|13,14 PER|14,17 PER|0,8 PHYS.Located|9,14 ORG-AFF.Employment

Both Kim and Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun told Weldon that Pyongyang planned to produce more nuclear weapons and had nearly finished reprocessing the spent nuclear fuel rods needed to do so , despite pressure from the United States and its allies .
1,2 PER|4,5 PER|5,8 PER|9,10 PER|11,12 GPE|17,18 WEA|37,39 GPE|41,42 GPE|11,18 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer

`` They admitted to having just about completed the reprocessing of 8,000 rods , '' said Weldon , a Republican who is the No . 2 member of a U.S. House panel that oversees the armed forces .

Mars rover is launched on voyage to look for evidence of water



CAPE CANAVERAL , Florida ( AP )
0,2 GPE|3,4 GPE|5,6 ORG
0,2 GPE|3,4 GPE|5,6 ORG

A rocket holding the first of two Mars rovers blasted off Tuesday on a seven - month voyage to the red planet where the golf - cart - sized vehicles will search for evidence that there was once enough water to support life on Mars .
1,2 VEH|7,8 LOC|8,9 VEH|21,22 LOC|24,27 VEH|29,30 VEH|44,45 LOC
1,2 VEH|7,8 LOC|8,9 VEH|21,22 LOC|24,27 VEH|29,30 VEH|44,45 LOC

The rover named Spirit lifted off from the Cape Canaveral Air Force Station aboard a Boeing Delta II rocket at 1:58 p.m. ( 1758 GMT ) .
1,2 VEH|3,4 VEH|8,13 FAC|15,16 ORG|16,18 VEH|18,19 VEH|1,19 PART-WHOLE.Artifact|15,19 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer
1,2 VEH|3,4 VEH|8,13 FAC|15,16 ORG|16,18 VEH|18,19 VEH|1,19 PART-WHOLE.Artifact|15,19 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer

Thunderstorms delayed the launch by two days , and launch officials contended with a last - minute communications glitch between stations that will track the spacecraft .
10,11 PER|20,21 FAC|25,26 VEH
10,11 PER|20,21 FAC|25,26 VEH

The second rover , named Opportunity , will be launched later this month , and both are expected to arrive at Mars in January .
2,3 VEH|5,6 VEH|21,22 LOC
2,3 VEH|5,6 VEH|21,22 LOC

Moving on six wheels , the $ 800 million rovers act as robotic geologists .
9,10 VEH|13,14 VEH
9,10 VEH|13,14 VEH

Each is equipped with a panoramic camera , a camera for close - up views of rocks and a drill to cut into rocks .



The data will be transmitted back to Earth .
7,8 LOC
7,8 LOC

Previous missions have shown Mars had water in the past , but scientists want to find out how long the water was there and in what quantities .
4,5 LOC|12,13 PER
4,5 LOC|12,13 PER

Scientists believe the water may show that Mars once was able to support life .
0,1 PER|7,8 LOC
0,1 PER|7,8 LOC

The rovers ' landing sites , on opposite sides of the planet , were chosen for their likelihood of holding evidence of water .
1,2 VEH|4,5 LOC|8,9 LOC|11,12 LOC|8,12 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
1,2 VEH|4,5 LOC|8,9 LOC|11,12 LOC|8,12 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

Studying the minerals in rocks can tell scientists how the rocks were formed , whether they were ever submerged in water , and whether hot water ever ran over them .
7,8 PER
7,8 PER

The rovers are expected to travel up to 132 feet ( 39.6 meters ) each Martian day , which is 24 hours and 39 { minutes long .
1,2 VEH|15,16 LOC
1,2 VEH|15,16 LOC

The missions are expected to last three months but could run longer . The rovers eventually will shut down as dust builds up on their solar panels and they will remain on the planet .
14,15 VEH|33,34 LOC
14,15 VEH|33,34 LOC

Only 12 out of 30 previous attempts have reached Mars , and only three out of nine attempts have succeeded in landing on the planet .
9,10 LOC|24,25 LOC
9,10 LOC|24,25 LOC

NASA revamped its Mars program after the failure of two unmanned missions to Mars four years ago .
0,1 ORG|3,4 LOC|13,14 LOC
0,1 ORG|3,4 LOC|13,14 LOC

The space agency has been under intense scrutiny since February when the space shuttle Columbia disintegrated over Texas , killing all seven crew members .
2,3 ORG|13,14 VEH|14,15 VEH|17,18 GPE|23,24 PER|14,24 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer
2,3 ORG|13,14 VEH|14,15 VEH|17,18 GPE|23,24 PER|14,24 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer

A logo patch of that last Columbia mission was attached to both Mars rovers .

04 - 03 - 03 02:16:00EST



By EDWARD EPSTEIN



c.2003 SAN FRANCISCO CHRONICLE



WASHINGTON _ Having punched through severely depleted Republican Guard divisions that formed Baghdad 's outer defensive ring , U.S. Army and Marine forces are likely to pause again to test the Iraqi capital 's inner defenses and waall but evaporated under the weight of the U.S. assault .

Their collapse left the U.S. troops less than 20 miles from Saddam Hussein 's capital .

Bet`fow Central Command chief Gen. Tommy Franks and his field commanders face a big decision _ whether to rush into the city of 5 million where Hussein 's regime has gathered its most - trusted forces or wait and see if the war can be won without paying the price of street - to - street urban fighting .

CIA SAYS NORTH KOREA HAS NEW NUCLEAR TESTING SITE AND TECHNOLOGY



WASHINGTON
0,1 GPE
0,1 GPE

U.S. intelligence officials now believe North Korea is developing the technology to make nuclear warheads small enough to fit atop the country 's growing arsenal of missideS ( potentially putting Tokyo and U.S. troops based in Japan at risk , according to officials who have received the intelligence reports .
0,1 GPE|1,2 ORG|2,3 PER|5,7 GPE|14,15 WEA|21,22 GPE|24,25 WEA|26,27 WEA|30,31 GPE|32,33 GPE|33,34 PER|36,37 GPE|42,43 PER|0,2 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|1,3 ORG-AFF.Employment|5,15 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer|6,15 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer|21,25 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer|32,34 ORG-AFF.Employment|33,37 PHYS.Located

In the assessment , which they have shared with Japan , South Korea and other allies in recent weeks , officials at the Central Intelligence Agency said that U.S. satellites have identified a sophisticated new nuclear testing site in an area called Youngdoktong .

At the site , equipment has been set up to test conventional explosives that , when detonated , could compress a plutonium core and set onfe nuclear explosion .

2,3 FAC|12,13 WEA

[ oMa intelligence officials believe that the existence of the testing range is evidence that the country intends to manufacture much more sophisticated weapons that would be light enough to put onto its growing arsenal of medium- and long - range missiles .

Previously , U.S. officials had said they were uncertain whether North Korea had received enough outside technical help to even attempt to make such a `` miniaturized '' nuclear warhead .

3,6 ORG|7,8 ORG|16,17 PER

In order to improve the epidemic control , Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture Chui Sai On , who has been named director of the SARS task force by the government , has designated representatives from the Health Services and the Center for Disease Prevention and Control to visit neighboring Guangdong Province on Thursday , to learn from Guangdong 's experience and know - how in combating SARS , which have been acknowledged by WHO .

0,1 PER|8,9 PER|12,13 PER
0,1 PER|8,9 PER|12,13 PER

7,8 PER|23,24 GPE
7,8 PER|23,24 GPE

14,15 GPE

LUXEMBOURG , June 16 ( Xinhua )
0,1 GPE|5,6 ORG
0,1 GPE|5,6 ORG

Foreign ministers of the European Union ( EU ) said here Monday that they fully supported stricter nuclear inspections of Iran 's nuclear programs by the International Atomic Energy Agency ( IAEA ) .
1,2 PER|4,6 GPE|7,8 GPE|20,21 GPE|26,30 ORG|31,32 ORG|1,5 ORG-AFF.Employment|1,6 ORG-AFF.Employment

A statement issued at the two - day meeting of the EU foreign ministers called on Iran to conclude and implement urgently and unconditionally an additional protocol to the Nuclear Non- Proliferation Treaty allowing for short - notice inspections of suspected nuclear sites in the country .
11,12 GPE|13,14 PER|16,17 GPE|42,43 LOC|45,46 GPE|11,14 ORG-AFF.Employment|42,46 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

4,5 GPE|9,10 GPE|21,22 ORG
4,5 GPE|9,10 GPE|21,22 ORG

" This would be a significant step in demonstrating Iran 's stated peaceful intentions with regard to its nuclear program , " the seven - point statement said .
9,10 GPE
9,10 GPE

20030624



China to build nuclear - powered desalinator project



JINAN , June 24 ( Xinhua )
0,1 GPE|5,6 ORG
0,1 GPE|5,6 ORG

China late this year will start building a nuclear - powered desalinator project in Yantai City in east China 's Shandong Province , with a designed capacity of producing 52 million tons of fresh water a year .
0,1 GPE|14,16 GPE|18,19 LOC|20,22 GPE|14,21 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|14,22 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|15,21 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|15,22 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|18,21 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|18,22 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
0,1 GPE|14,16 GPE|18,19 LOC|20,22 GPE|14,22 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|18,22 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

Officials with the Development Planning Commission of the Shandong provincial government said the project , to be built in cooperation with Qinghua University , would alleviate water shortages in the city and other parts of the Shandong Peninsula .
0,1 PER|3,6 ORG|8,9 GPE|10,11 GPE|21,23 ORG|30,31 GPE|36,38 GPE|0,4 ORG-AFF.Membership|0,5 ORG-AFF.Membership|0,6 ORG-AFF.Membership|3,11 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|4,11 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|5,11 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary
0,1 PER|3,6 ORG|8,9 GPE|10,11 GPE|21,23 ORG|30,31 GPE|36,38 GPE|0,6 ORG-AFF.Membership|3,11 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary

Yantai and other parts of Shandong suffered acute water shortages due to droughts in recent years , changing climate and other reasons .
0,1 GPE|5,6 GPE
0,1 GPE|5,6 GPE

Approved by the State Development and Reform Commission , the project is expected to cost 1.6 billion yuan ( nearly 200 million US dollars ) .
3,8 ORG|22,23 GPE
3,8 ORG|22,23 GPE

Zhang Zuoyi , director of the Nuclear Energy Technology and Design Institute attached to Qinghua University , was quoted in Monday 's Beijing Evening News as saying the fresh water to be produced from the project will cost 3.75 yuan per ton , much less than the cost of water from existing sources .
0,2 PER|3,4 PER|6,12 ORG|14,16 ORG|22,25 ORG|6,15 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|6,16 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|7,15 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|7,16 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|8,15 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|8,16 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|9,15 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|9,16 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|10,15 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|10,16 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|11,15 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary|11,16 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary
0,2 PER|3,4 PER|6,12 ORG|14,16 ORG|22,25 ORG|6,16 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary

The project is expected to use a 200-megawatt nuclear - powered reactor designed by the institute , according to the paper .
15,16 ORG|20,21 ORG
15,16 ORG|20,21 ORG

The project would be completed and operational in 2007 , it said .

Biography of Jo - Ann Bellucci



JBELLU ... @COMCAST.NET
0,3 PER
0,3 PER

Mon , 10 Jan 2005 02:57:20 -0800



Biography of Jo - Ann Bellucci
2,6 PER
2,6 PER

My biography changed completely 5 years ago when I contracted a very severe case of fibromyalga .



Usually I say nothing about it although it has severly limited my life , no truthly changed it completely !



This time I decided to just say it up front and go back and talk about the good old days , when life was a kick !



I now live in Watertown , MA , 12 miles from Boston 's Logan airport , in a lovely two family house I bought as an investment with my boss , my 9 year old Yorkshire Terrier , Teddy !
4,5 GPE|6,7 GPE|11,12 GPE|13,15 FAC|20,21 PER|21,22 FAC|4,7 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|11,14 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|11,15 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|13,22 PHYS.Near|14,22 PHYS.Near
4,5 GPE|6,7 GPE|11,12 GPE|13,15 FAC|20,21 PER|21,22 FAC|4,7 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|11,15 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|13,22 PHYS.Near

I just turned 50 years old this Christmas .



When I had a j.o.b .



I ran a software company for a few years and then started my own company , Pinnacle Business Enterprises and was under a 5 year exclusive contract with PriceWaterhouoseCoopers doing a lot of interesting things like Business Process Engineering , processes but mostly people and the effect new process would have on them . Showing them how to invite change into their lives because it freed them from the mundanne tasks and allowed them to use their great creativity instead of their backs .
4,5 ORG|14,15 ORG|16,19 ORG|28,29 ORG|43,44 PER
4,5 ORG|14,15 ORG|16,19 ORG|28,29 ORG|43,44 PER

I 'll get on to the more fun stuff ( read embarrassing , teasable stuff)in a minute but just one business story .



Those of you in Louisianna are very familiar with what used to be The Akzo Salt Mines .
4,5 GPE|14,17 FAC
4,5 GPE|14,17 FAC

On a client visit one day , unexpectedly , they dressed me up in safety equipment and ran me down the mine shaft .
2,3 PER|22,23 LOC
2,3 PER|22,23 LOC

I mention this because I never really got over , after that , how much we take advantage of evryday things ... like the salt on our tables or the rock salt that keeps the northern cities moving in the winter !
36,37 GPE
36,37 GPE

After I learned how to breath with my emergency apparatice I was driven around to see the manufacturing sites .
18,19 LOC
18,19 LOC

I 'm sure we are all familiar with those Yellow Tonka trucks little boys play with and move dirt from one place to another ....

Its then that I realized that life is ever so much more then you can see on the surface in all aspects !



Ok Chris ... here comes the stuff you can pay me back with .

Re : Good Morning Iraq
4,5 GPE
4,5 GPE

Let 's see ...



There two main qualities to be desired in a Commander - in - Chief , Generalship and Leadership .
9,14 PER
9,14 PER

Because in the United States the Commander - in - Chief is a purely political post , generalship is usually undertaken by the generals proper under the Commander - in - Chief , provided it is understood that the Commander - in - Chief is ultimately responsible and accountable for the outcomes of his general 's generalship .
3,5 GPE|6,11 PER|23,24 PER|27,32 PER|39,44 PER|54,55 PER|3,7 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,7 ORG-AFF.Employment|3,8 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,8 ORG-AFF.Employment|3,9 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,9 ORG-AFF.Employment|3,10 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,10 ORG-AFF.Employment|3,11 ORG-AFF.Employment|4,11 ORG-AFF.Employment
3,5 GPE|6,11 PER|23,24 PER|27,32 PER|39,44 PER|54,55 PER|3,11 ORG-AFF.Employment

Generalship involves the technical skills of intelligence gathering , strategic and tactical planning , and the communication of orders .



Leadership can be less rigidly defined and is concerned less with coordination than motivation and how a commander seeks to inspire his men to fight harder and endure worse privations in order to beat the enemy .
17,18 PER|22,23 PER|35,36 PER
17,18 PER|22,23 PER|35,36 PER

President Bush generalship has proven deficient .
0,1 PER|1,2 PER
0,1 PER|1,2 PER

His planning for the war was inadequate and his monitoring of the war after the invasion failed to correct course in the face of the change in circumstances brought by a strong and unexpected insurgency .



The Commander - in - Chief 's generalship can suffice to motivate men if they are higly confident that he is a very capable and skilled general . Eisenhower was in that position .
1,6 PER|12,13 PER|26,27 PER|28,29 PER
1,6 PER|12,13 PER|26,27 PER|28,29 PER

That has not been the case with President Bush , who unleashed hell acting on faulty intelligence , failed to find any WMD , and left our boys at war wanting for armor . That is not the sort of generalship that on rational grounds alone motivates men to march to possible death .
7,8 PER|8,9 PER|22,23 WEA|27,28 PER|47,48 PER
7,8 PER|8,9 PER|22,23 WEA|27,28 PER|47,48 PER

Men unmotivated by bad generalship can still be motivated by exceptional leadership .
0,1 PER
0,1 PER

In theory , motivation is best carried out by a commander fighting alongside his men .
10,11 PER|14,15 PER
10,11 PER|14,15 PER

Make no mistake , even when we do n't desire a president with a preference for personal combat , the need for a commander to be seen to share dangers with his men is as imperative today as it was in times of Alexander of Macedon .

0,2 PER

Mon , 28 Feb 2005 01:58:35 GMT



Re : Dell sued for " bait and switch " and false promises
2,3 ORG
2,3 ORG

Then there was the class action suit against Gateway brought by some Philadelphia lawyers a number of years ago .
8,9 ORG|12,13 GPE|13,14 PER|12,14 GEN-AFF.Citizen-Resident-Religion-Ethnicity
8,9 ORG|12,13 GPE|13,14 PER|12,14 GEN-AFF.Citizen-Resident-Religion-Ethnicity

Gateway advertised and stickered many of its 486 computers as " Pentium Ready " , meaning that a special Type 3 ZIF socket Pentium OverDrive could be installed and run .
0,1 ORG
0,1 ORG

Micronics designed the motherboards used by Gateway , and the basis of the design was a prototype Pentium OverDrive with an internal write - through cache , a more conservative cache design .
0,1 ORG|6,7 ORG
0,1 ORG|6,7 ORG

Then Intel changed the Pentium OverDrive , and the final version had a write - BACK cache .
1,2 ORG
1,2 ORG

When installed in a Gateway system , the chip ran slower than slow , maybe about as fast as an IBM AT , and bus - mastering devices like NICs and SCSI cards refused to work .
4,5 ORG|20,21 ORG
4,5 ORG|20,21 ORG

So the lawyers sued Gateway , and the settlement approved by the judge consisted of megabucks for the lawyers and coupons to owners of Gateway 486 computers .
2,3 PER|4,5 ORG|12,13 PER|18,19 PER|22,23 PER|24,25 ORG
2,3 PER|4,5 ORG|12,13 PER|18,19 PER|22,23 PER|24,25 ORG

The coupon was good for $ 50 off on the purchase of a Pentium OverDrive processor from Gateway , at its usual inflated prices ! ! !
17,18 ORG
17,18 ORG

So , let 's see .



What does a discount coupon for a processor I ca n't use in my system do for me ?



I wonder how many people gleefully cashed in their coupons and bought Pentium OverDrives from Gateway .
4,5 PER|15,16 ORG
4,5 PER|15,16 ORG

Intel eventually compensated by making available an " interposer " , a little socketed thingie installed between the Pentium OverDrive and the ZIF socket .
0,1 ORG
0,1 ORG

The sole purpose of the interposer was to raise a signal on the CPU to force its cache to operate in the write - thru mode which was compatible with most ZIF Socket 3 486 motherboards .



Needless to say , this was the least successful " OverDrive " CPU ever done by Intel .
16,17 ORG
16,17 ORG

The 486-DX4 OverDrive was OK , as were several Socket 5 Pentium OverDrives and the Socket 8 Pentium Pro OverDrive .



Finally Intel gave up on OverDrives ... Ben Myers
1,2 ORG|7,9 PER
1,2 ORG|7,9 PER

Nascar12
0,1 PER
0,1 PER

Sun , 27 Feb 2005 22:45:13 -0500

Since companies are going to be sued in class action , regardless of the merits of the case , the threat of a class action is not a detriment .
1,2 ORG
1,2 ORG

If you do n't believe that , witness the Vioxx lawsuits .



The company making Vioxx determined it might increase mortality and pulled it from the market .
1,2 ORG
1,2 ORG

Because of that , it is being sued .



The companies making similar drugs ( Celebrex and Bextra ) did not pull their product from the market .
1,2 ORG
1,2 ORG

They are not being sued .



Doing the right thing provides no protection from class action .



All class actions do is enrich lawyers and raise costs to everyone .
6,7 PER
6,7 PER

The cost of class actions is factored into the cost of everything you buy .

Re : waiver of extradition means what



The waiver of extradition that she signed simply means that if she skips out and goes to another state , she ca n't contest the right of the original court to have her hauled back to its jurisdiction , and that the court wo n't have to initiate the time - consuming process of extraditing her .
18,19 GPE|29,30 ORG|37,38 GPE|42,43 ORG
18,19 GPE|29,30 ORG|37,38 GPE|42,43 ORG

Instead , if the cops pick her up , she can be shipped back without delay .
4,5 PER
4,5 PER

7,8 PER

Re : waiver of extradition means what



She 's going to have a lot of separate offenses to account for by this time .



2 " FTA"s ( failure to appear ) , one in FL and one in AZ , plus whatever the original charges were in both cases .
11,12 GPE|15,16 GPE
11,12 GPE|15,16 GPE

1,2 PER

" He was confused , because of the medication but was not aggressive or threatening in any manner . I saw him each day and as soon as we spoke , he became oriented and was perfectly fine .
14,15 FAC|20,21 FAC|27,28 FAC

7,8 PER|10,11 PER

Fri , 18 Feb 2005 08:32:13 -0500



Re : S Corp Profit distribution and Bankrupcy .
2,4 ORG
2,4 ORG

Was the trustee informed of the transfer of the shares ?
2,3 PER
2,3 PER

Since you gave your uncle the shares prior to his discharge , the shares should have become assets available to the bankruptcy estate for the satisfaction of debts .
4,5 PER
4,5 PER

If the share transfer was reported to the trustee and the trustee did nothing about them , then you may be ok ; however , if you failed to inform the trustee , then your uncle may be liable for hiding assets , which would , at the minimum , invalidate his discharge .
8,9 PER|11,12 PER|31,32 PER|35,36 PER
8,9 PER|11,12 PER|31,32 PER|35,36 PER

Even if the transfer does n't invalidate the whole discharge , the distribution might be subject to forfeiture to pay creditors ' claims if you failed to inform the trustee of the share transfer .
20,21 PER|29,30 PER
20,21 PER|29,30 PER

You need to speak to a bankruptcy attorney pronto ; this is a bankruptcy matter , not a tax matter .
7,8 PER
7,8 PER

superprimen...@gmail.com
0,1 PER
0,1 PER

18 Feb 2005 10:49:15 -0800



Re : S Corp Profit distribution and Bankrupcy .
2,4 ORG
2,4 ORG

He had no shares in 2003 .



Shyster1040
0,1 PER
0,1 PER

Fri , 18 Feb 2005 14:21:23 -0500



Re : S Corp Profit distribution and Bankrupcy .
2,4 ORG
2,4 ORG

Yes , but according to the facts you first gave , he had not yet received the bankruptcy discharge when you gave him the shares .



I believe you had said that you gave him the shares in February 2004 but that the discharge did n't come until June of 2004 .



That means that he received the shares while he was still in bankruptcy , which means that the shares were potentially assets that the trustee could use to pay off creditors .
24,25 PER|30,31 PER
24,25 PER|30,31 PER

A bankruptcy case does n't close until you get the discharge order , and until then everything that the debtor receives is fair game for the trustee .
19,20 PER|26,27 PER
19,20 PER|26,27 PER

If the trustee was informed of the shares and did nothing about it , you are more likely than not ok , but if the trustee was n't informed of the fact directly , then you may be in trouble .
2,3 PER|25,26 PER
2,3 PER|25,26 PER

If , however , your uncle received the shares after he obtained an order of discharge from the bankruptcy court , then as a general matter the creditors can not go after the shares , unless they can prove that there was collusion between you and your uncle to hide his assets from them ( e.g. , by putting his assets in the corporation 's name and then waiting until after the bankruptcy to transfer the shares to him ) .
5,6 PER|19,20 ORG|27,28 PER|47,48 PER|63,64 ORG
5,6 PER|19,20 ORG|27,28 PER|47,48 PER|63,64 ORG

Tue , 08 Feb 2005 14:22:50 -0500



Re : [ TAN ] Parole



Getting out on parole is usually a reward for good behavior while serving time .



So you 're basically free , with the expectation that you will not leave the state ( assuming you 've been jailed by the state gov't ) and you have to check in with your parole officer on a regular basis ( I think they give you a schedule ) .
15,16 GPE|25,26 GPE|36,37 PER
15,16 GPE|25,26 GPE|36,37 PER

I * believe * you are also expected to get a job , housing , etc . and report this also .



In some cases you may be referred to a specific ' halfway ' house for reintroduction into society , and provided with a simple job .
13,14 FAC
13,14 FAC

As for how long it lasts , I would say that it lasts for the rest of your sentence , but I 'm not sure about that .



Also , you can call someone to come pick you up when you leave , or call a taxi I guess .
18,19 VEH
18,19 VEH

Not just state - specific , judge(jury)-specific and case - specific .
2,3 GPE|6,7 PER|6,7 PER
2,3 GPE|6,7 PER|6,7 PER

For some reason , I ca n't recall if selling drugs to minors qualifies as a jury trial or what .
12,13 PER|16,17 PER
12,13 PER|16,17 PER

But these decisions are entirely up to the judge / jury , and the decision is usually made in regard to the character of the defendant .
8,9 PER|10,11 PER|25,26 PER
8,9 PER|10,11 PER|25,26 PER

- Vinny R.

Re : [ TAN ] Parole



This is all based on my experience in New York .
8,10 GPE
8,10 GPE

You have to provide a planned residence when you 're considered for parole , usually a relative or program of some kind .
6,7 FAC|16,17 PER
6,7 FAC|16,17 PER

It lasts as long as the rest of your sentence lasts .



You can go back to prison for violating the conditions of your parole , for a period of time up until your sentence runs out .
5,6 FAC
5,6 FAC

Parole is not a right and its granting is discretionary . -- Kate Nepveu E - mail : knep...@steelypips.org Home : Book log :
12,14 PER
12,14 PER

Kate Nepveu
0,2 PER
0,2 PER

Thu , 10 Feb 2005 02:53:42 GMT



Re : [ TAN ] Parole



[ ... ]



Indeed , New York 's statute says , " Discretionary release on parole shall not be granted merely as a reward for good conduct or efficient performance of duties while confined but after considering if there is a reasonable probability that , if such inmate is released , he will live and remain at liberty without violating the law , and that his release is not incompatible with the welfare of society and will not so deprecate the seriousness of his crime as to undermine respect for law . " N.Y. Executive Law 259-i(2)(c)(A ) .
2,4 GPE|44,45 PER|90,91 GPE
2,4 GPE|44,45 PER|90,91 GPE

( Instead , there are ways of getting your parole eligibility date moved up for good behavior , or of creating strong presumptions in favor of parole release . ) --



/



Rich
0,1 PER
0,1 PER

0,1 PER|4,5 PER

7,8 PER|10,11 GPE

8,9 PER
8,9 PER

But Kerry actually won by about 750,000 votes .
1,2 PER
1,2 PER

The numbers were changed by a computer program ( in both electronic and scan - tron voting systems ) called " KerryLite.""KerryLite " of course is not actual name of the program .
21,22 PER|21,22 PER
21,22 PER|21,22 PER

The actual name is 11 - 5 - 18 - 18 etc .



For additional encryption , the numbers were jumbled but I 'm not sure in which order .



The numbers replace the letters of the alphabet .



For example , K is the eleventh letter of the alphabet .



So the if - then statement goes something like this : " if total true Kerry)total true Bush , Bush x 1.04x ( .04 is a random number)(total true Kerry ) , total true Bush " .
15,16 PER|17,18 PER|19,20 PER|29,30 PER|34,35 PER
15,16 PER|17,18 PER|19,20 PER|29,30 PER|34,35 PER

The second part of the equation takes the total number of votes cast and subtracts the new Bush total , subtracts the third party totals and leaves the rest for Kerry .
17,18 PER|23,24 ORG|30,31 PER
17,18 PER|23,24 ORG|30,31 PER

Sometimes the program would also reduce third party votes and award them to Bush .
7,8 ORG|13,14 PER
7,8 ORG|13,14 PER

And even where Bush legitimately won , he was still awarded additional votes .
3,4 PER
3,4 PER

2,3 ORG|3,4 GPE|5,6 GPE|11,12 PER
2,3 ORG|3,4 GPE|5,6 GPE|11,12 PER

It 's interesting to see this unfold .



Does anybody wonder why the Republican counties were mostly counted after the Democratic counties ? You should wonder , and also know that this was no accident . The Bush team had to make up the votes as the night went on .
5,6 ORG|6,7 GPE|12,13 ORG|13,14 GPE|29,30 PER|30,31 PER
5,6 ORG|6,7 GPE|12,13 ORG|13,14 GPE|29,30 PER|30,31 PER

In Ohio , computer voting fraud , vote tossing and voter suppression were the main methods .
1,2 GPE
1,2 GPE

Vote tossing was simply the removal of Kerry votes and some third party votes .
7,8 PER|12,13 ORG
7,8 PER|12,13 ORG

In some areas , the Bush vs. Kerry votes were absurd .
2,3 LOC|5,6 PER|7,8 PER

0,1 PER|7,8 PER
0,1 PER|7,8 PER

This of course took place in Democratic areas .
6,7 ORG|7,8 LOC
6,7 ORG|7,8 LOC

The simplest thing to do was to have too few voting machines .



Sometimes that 's all it takes .



People eventually lose patience and leave without casting a vote .
0,1 PER
0,1 PER

In other states such as New Mexico , Nevada , Iowa and New Hampshire , Kerry 's leads evaporated very quickly once the polls were shut down .
2,3 GPE|5,7 GPE|8,9 GPE|10,11 GPE|12,14 GPE|15,16 PER|2,6 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|2,7 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|2,9 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|2,11 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|2,13 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|2,14 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

Kerry only won New Hampshire , but barely .
0,1 PER|3,5 GPE

WEB TEXT



2005 - 02 - 17T20:19:00



There is one Carousel organization again



Rapid T. Rabbit
0,3 PER
0,3 PER

17 Feb 2005 17:19:51 -0800



There is one Carousel organization again
4,5 ORG
4,5 ORG

I just received the latest issue of Merry - Go - Roundup , the quarterly publication of the National Carousel Association .
18,21 ORG
18,21 ORG

In it was a blurb reporting that the American Carousel Society had recently disbanded .
8,11 ORG
8,11 ORG

Some of you may be wondering why there were two carousel organizations in the first place .
11,12 ORG
11,12 ORG

The National Carousel Association was founded in the early 1970 's by a group of art historians and collectors , including Frederick Fried , author of the 1964 book " A Pictorial History of The Carousel " that single - handedly gave the classic hand - carved wooden carousel the respect and appreciation it deserved .
1,4 ORG|13,14 PER|16,17 PER|18,19 PER|21,23 PER|24,25 PER
1,4 ORG|13,14 PER|16,17 PER|18,19 PER|21,23 PER|24,25 PER

Other founders included Charlotte Dinger , who was already a major collector of carousel artwork at the time .
1,2 PER|3,5 PER|11,12 PER
1,2 PER|3,5 PER|11,12 PER

The purpose of the NCA is " to promote conservation , appreciation , knowledge and enjoyment of the art of the classic wooden carousel and especially the preservation of complete wooden carousels . "
4,5 ORG
4,5 ORG

The organization attracted a wide range of members , including carousel enthusiasts , owners / operators , theme and amusement parks , museums , libraries , those in the entertainment / recreation industry , art collectors and even auction houses , among others .
1,2 ORG|7,8 PER|11,12 PER|13,14 PER|15,16 PER|20,21 ORG|22,23 ORG|24,25 ORG|32,33 ORG|35,36 PER|39,40 ORG|1,8 ORG-AFF.Membership
1,2 ORG|7,8 PER|11,12 PER|13,14 PER|15,16 PER|20,21 ORG|22,23 ORG|24,25 ORG|32,33 ORG|35,36 PER|39,40 ORG|1,8 ORG-AFF.Membership

It was the presence of these last two named groups that would eventually stir up controversy .
9,10 PER
9,10 PER

Thanks in large part to the NCA , the art of the carousel was receiving a lot of public attention and appreciation that it had not enjoyed before .
6,7 ORG
6,7 ORG

However , this new and brighter spotlight on these antique rides also had the unfortunate effect of enhancing the collectibility and monetary value of operational carousels .



They had become worth more money dead ( i.e. in pieces ) than alive ( i.e. functioning ) .



As such , during the 1980 's many beautiful and unique wooden carousels would be broken up at the auction block , as owners rushed to cash in on the antique marketplace .
23,24 PER
23,24 PER

The liability insurance crisis further aggravated the situation , as amusement park operators sought to cut their losses , while at the same time liquidate underperforming carousels to raise capital for the purchase of newer and more profitable ( thrill ) rides .
11,12 ORG|12,13 PER|11,13 ORG-AFF.Ownership
11,12 ORG|12,13 PER|11,13 ORG-AFF.Ownership

Some collectors of carousel art and auction houses were accused of using their NCA affiliation to gain information about vintage carousels that they could target for breakup to their own personal profit , a practice certainly contrary to the stated goals of the organization . The increasing rift between the " preservationists " and " collectors " would eventually boil over into an internal political struggle that caused many in the collectors faction of the NCA to walk out of the group , including founders such as Charlotte Dinger and others .
1,2 PER|7,8 ORG|13,14 ORG|43,44 ORG|51,52 PER|55,56 PER|71,72 PER|72,73 PER|75,76 ORG|81,82 ORG|84,85 PER|87,89 PER|72,76 ORG-AFF.Membership|81,85 ORG-AFF.Founder
1,2 PER|7,8 ORG|13,14 ORG|43,44 ORG|51,52 PER|55,56 PER|71,72 PER|72,73 PER|75,76 ORG|81,82 ORG|84,85 PER|87,89 PER|72,76 ORG-AFF.Membership|81,85 ORG-AFF.Founder

The preservationists would chose to remain with the NCA , including Fred Fried .
1,2 PER|8,9 ORG|11,13 PER|1,9 ORG-AFF.Membership|8,12 ORG-AFF.Membership|8,13 ORG-AFF.Membership
1,2 PER|8,9 ORG|11,13 PER|1,9 ORG-AFF.Membership|8,13 ORG-AFF.Membership

At this time in the late 1970 's , carousel artwork collector and printer Marge Swenson was the editor of the NCA 's Merry - Go - Roundup publication . The political struggle that occurred within the NCA resulted in two slates of officers being presented for approval to the membership , something that was not supposed to happen .
11,12 PER|13,14 PER|14,16 PER|18,19 PER|21,22 ORG|37,38 ORG|43,44 PER|50,51 PER|18,22 ORG-AFF.Employment|37,44 ORG-AFF.Membership|37,51 ORG-AFF.Membership
11,12 PER|13,14 PER|14,16 PER|18,19 PER|21,22 ORG|37,38 ORG|43,44 PER|50,51 PER|18,22 ORG-AFF.Employment|37,44 ORG-AFF.Membership|37,51 ORG-AFF.Membership

A thicker - than - usual issue of the Roundup would be filled with accusations from both factions in the group each accusing the other of improper behavior .
17,18 PER|20,21 ORG|17,21 ORG-AFF.Membership
17,18 PER|20,21 ORG|17,21 ORG-AFF.Membership

Swenson herself would also leave the NCA .
0,1 PER|6,7 ORG|0,7 ORG-AFF.Membership
0,1 PER|6,7 ORG|0,7 ORG-AFF.Membership

Not much later , she began publishing her own magazine called " Carousel Art " , which was essentially a scholarly photo album depicting different carvers and styles each month .
25,26 PER
25,26 PER

Meanwhile , those collectors who left the National Carousel Association banded together to form the American Carousel Society ( ACS ) , whose stated aims of carousel preservation also recognized collectors as a positive asset towards that goal .
3,4 PER|7,10 ORG|15,18 ORG|19,20 ORG|30,31 PER|3,8 ORG-AFF.Membership|3,9 ORG-AFF.Membership|3,10 ORG-AFF.Membership|3,16 ORG-AFF.Founder|3,17 ORG-AFF.Founder|3,18 ORG-AFF.Founder
3,4 PER|7,10 ORG|15,18 ORG|19,20 ORG|30,31 PER|3,10 ORG-AFF.Membership|3,18 ORG-AFF.Founder

For the next couple of decades , the two carousel organizations would co - exist , each attracting its share of members .
10,11 ORG|21,22 PER
10,11 ORG|21,22 PER

Some would actually join both groups , and even attend both of their annual conventions .
5,6 ORG
5,6 ORG

During the mid-1980 's Walter Louck would begin publishing " The Carousel Trader " , later renamed " The Carousel News & amp ; Trader " .
4,6 PER
4,6 PER

This monthly magazine would cover all angles and sides of the story of the carousel and be well received by all carousel enthusiasts .
22,23 PER
22,23 PER

About a decade later , Carousel Art would suddenly cease publication .



The NCA would continue to issue the Roundup to its members .
1,2 ORG|10,11 PER
1,2 ORG|10,11 PER

The mid to late 1990 's saw the passing of NCA founder Fred Fried , and also that of Charlotte Dinger , both who represented the two opposite points of view in the carousel preservation debate .
10,11 ORG|11,12 PER|12,14 PER|19,21 PER|10,12 ORG-AFF.Founder
10,11 ORG|11,12 PER|12,14 PER|19,21 PER|10,12 ORG-AFF.Founder

Coincidentally and amazingly , the art of building hand - carved carousels ( and even bandorgans ) has been revived , with firms such as Carousel Works and Carousel Magic again building the popular rides in classic design .
22,23 ORG|25,27 ORG|28,30 ORG
22,23 ORG|25,27 ORG|28,30 ORG

This development seems to have greatly alleviated the antique marketplace pressures that have doomed so many legacy wooden carousels over the past several decades .



The turn of the new millenium actually witnessesed a thaw in the relationship between the National Carousel Association and American Carousel Society , as newer and younger leadership took over from the founding generation .
15,18 ORG|19,22 ORG|27,28 PER|33,34 PER
15,18 ORG|19,22 ORG|27,28 PER|33,34 PER

The two groups decided that the bickering between them was wasteful , conterproductive and pointless .
2,3 ORG
2,3 ORG

There was talk of a ( re)merger but the regulations governing non - profits prevented that . However , it was decided that NCA and ACS hold joint conventions to save on costs to both the clubs and the members .
11,14 ORG|23,24 ORG|25,26 ORG|36,37 ORG|39,40 PER|36,40 ORG-AFF.Membership
11,14 ORG|23,24 ORG|25,26 ORG|36,37 ORG|39,40 PER|36,40 ORG-AFF.Membership

Just within the past couple of months though , the American Carousel Society had determined that they did not have the funding to continue with the operation of their organization and officially ceased to exist .
10,13 ORG|29,30 ORG
10,13 ORG|29,30 ORG

So now , once again there is a single nationwide organization to join if you love carousels !
10,11 ORG
10,11 ORG

Rapid T. Rabbit
0,3 PER
0,3 PER

Club Sports policies at schools ; specifically travel restrictions



d-c...@northwestern.edu
0,1 PER
0,1 PER

9 Feb 2005 19:02:57 -0800



Club Sports policies at schools ; specifically travel restrictions
0,1 ORG|4,5 ORG
0,1 ORG|4,5 ORG

Hello everyone -



I am attempting to learn more information about the policies of various athletic departments at schools , specifically with regards to ultimate teams .
13,14 ORG|15,16 ORG|22,23 ORG|13,16 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary
13,14 ORG|15,16 ORG|22,23 ORG|13,16 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary

At Northwestern , the Men 's Ultimate team falls under the Club Sports department which falls into a dark , barely lit corner of the Athletic Department .
1,2 ORG|4,5 PER|7,8 ORG|13,14 ORG|26,27 ORG|4,8 ORG-AFF.Sports-Affiliation|7,14 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary
1,2 ORG|4,5 PER|7,8 ORG|13,14 ORG|26,27 ORG|4,8 ORG-AFF.Sports-Affiliation|7,14 PART-WHOLE.Subsidiary

There are some restrictions on what we can and can not do .



The one that I am most interested in comparing to similar policies at other schools concerns our ability to travel .
14,15 ORG
14,15 ORG

At Northwestern , we are allowed to either rent school vans for no charge or take our own vehicles to tournaments within 300 miles of Evanston , IL .
1,2 ORG|9,10 ORG|10,11 VEH|18,19 VEH|25,26 GPE|27,28 GPE|9,11 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer|25,28 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
1,2 ORG|9,10 ORG|10,11 VEH|18,19 VEH|25,26 GPE|27,28 GPE|9,11 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer|25,28 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

Also , we are allowed to fly , take a bus , or take Amtrak to any tournament we want , no matter how far away it is .
10,11 VEH|14,15 VEH
10,11 VEH|14,15 VEH

We are allowed to compete under the Northwestern name if we take any of these options .
7,8 ORG
7,8 ORG

However , it often occurs that we want to go to a tournament farther than 300 miles without flying .



( For example , Regionals is often slightly farther than 300 miles , yet a reasonable drive . ) If we choose to do so , it is understood that we are not officially competing under the Northwestern name - we are just a group of people playing ultimate at a tournament and not involving the university in any way .
37,38 ORG|44,45 ORG|46,47 PER|56,57 ORG
37,38 ORG|44,45 ORG|46,47 PER|56,57 ORG

Do any of you other college players face similar restrictions in your travel ?
5,6 ORG|6,7 PER|5,7 ORG-AFF.Student-Alum
5,6 ORG|6,7 PER|5,7 ORG-AFF.Student-Alum

What are your schools ' policies ?
3,4 ORG
3,4 ORG

I am interested in both the responses of players at public and private schools .
8,9 PER|13,14 ORG|8,14 ORG-AFF.Student-Alum
8,9 PER|13,14 ORG|8,14 ORG-AFF.Student-Alum

Feel free to email me if you do want to post to the forum .



Thanks for your help .



Cesa Northwestern d-c...@northwestern.edu
0,1 PER|1,2 ORG|0,2 ORG-AFF.Student-Alum
0,1 PER|1,2 ORG|0,2 ORG-AFF.Student-Alum

1,2 FAC|8,9 FAC

1,2 ORG|21,22 PER
1,2 ORG|21,22 PER

Explain to them that if you are driving your own cars , you should be able to go wherever you want , and even throw in there if for any reason you bring shame to the university , you will go right back to the old policy no questions asked .
10,11 VEH|36,37 ORG
10,11 VEH|36,37 ORG

15,16 PER
15,16 PER

pretty much never so your safe with that offer .



Another thing we did was have a lot of fundraisers on campus , entered banner contests for sporting events , etc .
11,12 FAC
11,12 FAC

2,3 ORG|9,10 ORG|22,23 ORG

15,16 PER

Post - trip report - London
5,6 GPE
5,6 GPE

Hi All ,



We * just * got back into Washington last evening , after our brief 5-day trip to London .
7,8 GPE|17,18 GPE
7,8 GPE|17,18 GPE

Thanks for all of the responses to my earlier inquiries , I 'm happy to report that everything went pretty well , but both my wife and I are pretty beat / tired .
25,26 PER
25,26 PER

We got into Heathrow on Monday morning .
3,4 FAC
3,4 FAC

At the airport , I got some cash from the Barclays ATM just outside the arrival area , as many have suggested .
2,3 FAC|10,11 ORG|16,17 FAC|2,17 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
2,3 FAC|10,11 ORG|16,17 FAC|2,17 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

FYI , I just checked my bank account , and we got charged a $ 2.00 fee and the exchange rate was around $ 1.92/GPB .
6,7 ORG
6,7 ORG

After that , we took the underground into London .
6,7 VEH|8,9 GPE
6,7 VEH|8,9 GPE

Zone 1 - 6 all - day pass cost 5.40 GBP each .
0,1 LOC
0,1 LOC

That was pretty easy ... the most difficult part was finding the hotel once we finally got off at the final tube station .
12,13 FAC|21,22 VEH|22,23 FAC
12,13 FAC|21,22 VEH|22,23 FAC

The hotel was nice enough to let us check in , even though we were a bit early ( we got in around 12:30 , normal check - in time was 14:30 ) , which we were really grateful for , after dragging our bags for a couple of hours .
1,2 ORG
1,2 ORG

After settling into the hotel room ( my wife is an " unpack everything - and - stow it " type of person ) , we went to do a little exploring .
4,5 FAC|5,6 FAC|8,9 PER|22,23 PER|4,6 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
4,5 FAC|5,6 FAC|8,9 PER|22,23 PER|4,6 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

Being that this was a holiday , a lot of the local places were closed ( including restaurants in the hotel ) , but we found a kind of combo newsagent / foodstore nearby , and we picked up a 5 GBP calling card ( for calling home ) and some drinks ( 1.59 GPB for ~2 liter Pepsi light , .98 GBP for a ~2 liter water ) .
12,13 FAC|17,18 FAC|20,21 FAC|30,31 ORG|32,33 ORG|47,48 GPE|58,59 ORG|17,21 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
12,13 FAC|17,18 FAC|20,21 FAC|30,31 ORG|32,33 ORG|47,48 GPE|58,59 ORG|17,21 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

It took us awhile , but we found a restaurant / pub ( White Swan ) that was open .
13,15 FAC
13,15 FAC

It seemed like a kind of local place , and the woman that was running the place was very nice .
7,8 FAC|11,12 PER|16,17 FAC
7,8 FAC|11,12 PER|16,17 FAC

When we walked in , we stood around waiting to be seated :) , and she said " this is a pub , sit anywhere , and order at the bar " .
21,22 FAC|30,31 FAC
21,22 FAC|30,31 FAC

I gathered ( from that and a few visits at other pubs ) that that 's the norm .
11,12 FAC
11,12 FAC

Anyway , we had a nice late lunch : fish and chips ( with " mashed peas " ) for me , and a beef pie for my wife .
28,29 PER
28,29 PER

FYI , this was probably the most reasonable meal that we had during our whole visit .



That night , we walked around the area around the Victoria underground station , because we were suppose to meet up with a tour the next morning .
7,8 LOC|10,13 FAC|23,24 PER|7,11 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|7,12 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|7,13 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
7,8 LOC|10,13 FAC|23,24 PER|7,13 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

While there , we found a local Sainsbury ( kind of a small supermarket ) about 2 blocks from the underground station , and stocked up on some cheese , milk , and croissants .
7,8 FAC|13,14 FAC|20,21 VEH|21,22 FAC|7,22 PHYS.Near
7,8 FAC|13,14 FAC|20,21 VEH|21,22 FAC|7,22 PHYS.Near

Prices here were a bit cheaper than the local foodstore , and during our trip , I made several trips here :) .
9,10 FAC
9,10 FAC

We were n't sure what we wanted to eat for dinner , so we just wandered around a bit , and finally ended up at a " steakhouse " near the station ... big mistake .
27,28 FAC|31,32 FAC|27,32 PHYS.Near
27,28 FAC|31,32 FAC|27,32 PHYS.Near

The food , service , and prices were very bad ... I guess we should have figured that one out when 3 other parties walked out AFTER being seated , but unfortunately , we had already ordered , so we felt kind of obligated to finish .
23,24 PER
23,24 PER

I do n't know if this is the case with all " steakhouses " , but we stayed away from them all after that :( .
12,13 ORG
12,13 ORG

We took an all day bus tour ( Evan Evans ) , including the London Eye . Took the underground to Victoria , and walked to the Victoria Coach Station ( it 's NOT the same :)) .
5,6 VEH|8,10 ORG|14,16 FAC|19,20 VEH|21,22 FAC|27,30 FAC|5,9 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer|5,10 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer|19,22 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
5,6 VEH|8,10 ORG|14,16 FAC|19,20 VEH|21,22 FAC|27,30 FAC|5,10 ART.User-Owner-Inventor-Manufacturer|19,22 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

I thought that the tour was a pretty good way to get introduced to part of the city .
17,18 GPE
17,18 GPE

We got to see a lot in a short time , including extended tours of Westminster ( felt kind of strange walking over dead people ) and the Tower of London ( neat ! ) .
15,16 FAC|24,25 PER|28,31 FAC
15,16 FAC|24,25 PER|28,31 FAC

This tour included lunch at another pub near Trafalgar Square ( more beef pies for us ) , and the tour guide was very good , and kind of funny .
6,7 FAC|8,10 FAC|21,22 PER|6,9 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|6,10 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
6,7 FAC|8,10 FAC|21,22 PER|6,10 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

It was kind of like travelling with a " grand dad " and he did his best to keep us all together .
9,11 PER
9,11 PER

At the end of the land tour , we went on ride on one of the Thames cruise boats ( warning , it is FREEZING on the top deck ... ) , and then a ride on the London Eye .
16,17 LOC|18,19 VEH|28,29 VEH|38,40 FAC
16,17 LOC|18,19 VEH|28,29 VEH|38,40 FAC

All in all , recommended , but afterwards , both my wife and I agreed that an " all - day " tour was too exhausting ( even on a bus tour , you have to do a LOT of walking especially getting to the Changing of the Guards and at the London Tower ) , and we probably would 've preferred breaking it into 2 1/2 day tours .
11,12 PER|30,31 VEH|48,49 PER|52,54 FAC
11,12 PER|30,31 VEH|48,49 PER|52,54 FAC

We also took one of the hop - on / hop - off bus tours ( the " Original " ) on one of the other day , as we thought it was the easiest way to get around to the places that we wanted to re - visit .
13,14 VEH|41,42 LOC
13,14 VEH|41,42 LOC

A couple of comments : take the one with the live guide if you can , as it 's much more interesting than the ones with the recorded commentary ( you can ask questions ) .
11,12 PER
11,12 PER

Also , if you want to get a seat on the top deck , take one of the earlier buses , as at least when we were there , it was impossible to get a seat on top later in the day , and you ca n't see much from the lower ( enclosed ) deck ( but it 's much warmer : ) ! ) .
12,13 VEH|19,20 VEH|37,38 VEH|55,56 VEH
12,13 VEH|19,20 VEH|37,38 VEH|55,56 VEH

We had been buying the 2-zone all - day tube passes ( 4.20 GBP each ) everyday , just to get around to dinner and shopping on our own , but by the time this was all over , my wife did n't feel like taking the underground back to Heathrow , so we had asked the hotel conceierge to make a reservation on an airport bus ( 15 GBP each ) , but he instead offered that he could get us a private car direct to the airport for 35 GBP , which is what we did .
5,6 LOC|9,10 VEH|40,41 PER|47,48 VEH|50,51 FAC|57,58 ORG|58,59 PER|65,66 FAC|66,67 VEH|84,85 VEH|88,89 FAC|57,59 ORG-AFF.Employment
5,6 LOC|9,10 VEH|40,41 PER|47,48 VEH|50,51 FAC|57,58 ORG|58,59 PER|65,66 FAC|66,67 VEH|84,85 VEH|88,89 FAC|57,59 ORG-AFF.Employment

This was perfect , because it got us door - to - door from the hotel to LHR Terminal 3 with no hassles at all .
15,16 FAC|17,18 FAC|18,20 FAC|17,19 PART-WHOLE.Geographical|17,20 PART-WHOLE.Geographical
15,16 FAC|17,18 FAC|18,20 FAC|17,20 PART-WHOLE.Geographical

I would n't have done that from LHR to the hotel , but since the concierge was arranging it , I felt that it 'd be safe , and the driver turned out to be pretty nice .
7,8 FAC|10,11 FAC|15,16 PER|30,31 PER
7,8 FAC|10,11 FAC|15,16 PER|30,31 PER

Overall , it was an enjoyable , but really exhausting trip ( we live in the suburbs , so I guess we 're not use to walking everywhere ) .
16,17 LOC
16,17 LOC

Luckily this was n't a " shopping " trip , because things are ( at least from Americans ) really expensive .
17,18 GPE
17,18 GPE

I think that if I was dealing in GPBs all the time , it would n't seem so bad , but I remember sitting at the ice cream ( " gelato " ? ) counter at Harrods , and watching two little kids , each eating some sundaes that cost 15 GPB each ( $ 30.00 ) , and thinking " wow ! " . Jim
36,37 FAC|42,43 PER|65,66 PER

Did you miss the inaugural address ?

Re : Did you miss the inaugural address ?



The administration 's approach to history is at odds with what has been described by a communications adviser to the president as the " reality - based community . " A dumb phrase , but not a dumb thought : He meant that the administration sees history as dynamic and changeable , not static and impervious to redirection or improvement .
1,2 ORG|17,18 PER|20,21 PER|44,45 ORG|17,21 PER-SOC.Business
1,2 ORG|17,18 PER|20,21 PER|44,45 ORG|17,21 PER-SOC.Business

That is the Bush administration way , and it happens to be realistic : History is dynamic and changeable .
3,4 PER|4,5 ORG|3,5 ORG-AFF.Membership
3,4 PER|4,5 ORG|3,5 ORG-AFF.Membership

On the other hand , some things are constant , such as human imperfection , injustice , misery and bad government .
12,13 PER|20,21 ORG
12,13 PER|20,21 ORG

This world is not heaven .
1,2 LOC
1,2 LOC

The president 's speech seemed rather heavenish .
1,2 PER
1,2 PER

It was a God - drenched speech .
3,4 PER
3,4 PER

This president , who has been accused of giving too much attention to religious imagery and religious thought , has not let the criticism enter him .
1,2 PER
1,2 PER

God was invoked relentlessly . " The Author of Liberty.""God moves and chooses as He wills .
0,1 PER|7,8 PER|9,10 PER
0,1 PER|7,8 PER|9,10 PER

We have confidence because freedom is the permanent hope of mankind . . .
10,11 PER
10,11 PER

the longing of the soul . "



Ending tyranny in the world ?
4,5 LOC
4,5 LOC

Well that 's an ambition , and if you 're going to have an ambition it might as well be a big one .



But this declaration , which is not wrong by any means , seemed to me to land somewhere between dreamy and disturbing .



Tyranny is a very bad thing and quite wicked , but one does n't expect we 're going to eradicate it any time soon .



Again , this is not heaven , it 's earth .
9,10 LOC
9,10 LOC

This is -- how else to put it ?-- over the top .



It is the kind of sentence that makes you wonder if this White House did not , in the preparation period , have a case of what I have called in the past " mission inebriation . " A sense that there are few legitimate boundaries to the desires born in the goodness of their good hearts .
12,14 ORG
12,14 ORG

One wonders if they should n't ease up , calm down , breathe deep , get more securely grounded .



The most moving speeches summon us to the cause of what is actually possible .



Perfection in the life of man on earth is not . -- Peggy Noonan
